intro: Spryginia undulata, commonly known as the wavy spryginia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Spryginia undulata is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
